newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities closed narrowly mixed in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, dealers said on Tuesday.

"The interbank rate eased slightly again today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were narrowly mixed but bond prices were slightly lower. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.25/2.20 percent compared with Monday's yield of 1.80/1.75 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.47/2.42 percent against 2.37/2.32 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$97.86/97.91 from Monday's close of S$98.00/98.05, September 2001 at S$96.52/96.57 versus S$96.85/96.90 and June 2003 at S$94.50/94.55 against S$94.85/94.90.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased to 3-5/8 3-1/2 percent from Monday's 3-11/16 3-9/16 percent.
